alert.note: Alert for St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 20 at 4:40AM AKST until February 22 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THIS MORNING... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TUESDAY TO 9 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from 3 AM Tuesday to 9 PM AKST Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM AKST this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast
